He's that bar that we have to set for ourselves. turned on to it," said NBA deputy commissioner Russ Granik , who was at Philadelphia's First Union Center on Wednesday night, when Allen Iverson scored 54 points to Vince Carter 's 28 in the 76ers' 97-92 victory. For better or worse, fans like it when you get superstars going against each other. People have been hearing about these guys for years now, but they haven't gotten this far before where they met each other at this level. That guy gets people interested. With the NBA's overall popularity declining and new rules designed to make the game more appealing set to take effect next season, an Iverson-Carter matchup is what the league really needed.
